DOC.brief_summary: To determine if the analysis of exhaled breath condensate correlates with the development & resolution of pneumonia.
DOC.brief_title: Serial, Non-invasive Analysis of Exhaled Breath Condensate in Ventilated Trauma Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This proposal investigates the utility of exhaled breath condensate fluid (EBCF) collected from heat moisture exchange (HME) filters connected to patient's endotracheal tubes for early, non-invasive detection of ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP) in critically ill or injured ICU patients. The development of pneumonia during mechanical ventilation is the most common healthcare-associated infection in severely injured patients, accounting for substantial morbidity, excess ICU and hospital stay, additional cost and increased mortality.
